newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to invest $80 mln in U.K. lab.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to invest $80 mln in U.K. lab.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said early Tuesday that its research arm plans to invest $80 million, or 50 million stg, to establish a basic research lab at Cambridge University.
Microsoft Research plans to collaborate closely with Cambridge University to conduct basic research in computer science.

"Our goal with this Cambridge-based research lab is to create a home for those world-class researchers based in Europe who want to develop innovative new technologies and have an impact on the lives of millions of people around the world," Microsoft Chief Technology Officer Nathan Myhrvold said in a statement.
In addition, Microsoft also said it would invest $16 million, or 10 million stg, in small technology companies and their ventures, with an emphasis on Cambridge-area technology firms.
The director of Microsoft Research Cambridge will be Roger Needham, who is professor of computer systems in the university's computer laboratory and pro vice chancellor of the university.

Microsoft Research Ltd, as the venture is to be called, will be located in central Cambridge. It has begun hiring researchers from Europe, and expects to build up to 25 researchers in its first year, Microsoft said.

Of the 10 million stg Microsoft plans to invest in small technology companies, about 5 million stg is to be invested in Amadeus I, a new venture capital fund created to support early stage technology companies with global potential.
The remainder will be reserved for future investment opportunities.
